title: Letters to the Editor:  Computers Fueled '80s Boom
text:
In "Inflation and the Trump Factor" (Business World, June 15), Holman Jenkins, Jr. writes, "It's no exaggeration to say the 1970s inflationary upheaval produced the resurgent '80s and '90s." I disagree; the IBM PC was introduced in August 1981. That, and other developments in computing and technology in general, are what fueled the '80s and '90s and thereafter.

Allen Kaplan

Benicia, Calif.
